Biyadihi ‘l-khayr, 
wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr.

title: When the mounted animal (or mean of transport) stumbles

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/296. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/941.
hadiths.text: بِسْـمِ اللهِ
hadiths.translation: With the Name of Allah.
hadiths.transliteration: Bismillāh.

title: Supplication of the traveller for the resident

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Ahmad 2/403, Ibn Majah 2/943. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/133.
hadiths.text: أَسْتَـوْدِعُكُـمُ اللَّهَ الَّذي لا تَضـيعُ وَدائِعُـه
hadiths.translation: I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
hadiths.transliteration: Astawdi`ukumu ‘llāha ‘l-ladhi lā taḍī`u wadā'i`uh.

title: Supplication of the resident for the traveller

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Ahmad 2/7, At-Tirmidhi 5/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/155.
hadiths.text:
أَسْتَـوْدِعُ اللَّهَ ديـنَكَ
وَأَمانَتَـكَ، 
وَخَـواتيـمَ عَمَـلِك
hadiths.translation:
I leave your religion in the care of Allah, 
as well as your safety, 
and the last of your deeds.
hadiths.transliteration:
Astawdi`ullāha dīnak, 
wa amānatak, 
wa khawātīma `amalik.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi, 3/155.
hadiths.text:
زَوَّدَكَ اللَّهُ التقْوى، 
وَغَفَـرَذَنْـبَكَ، 
وَيَسَّـرَ لَكَ الخَـيْرَ حَيْـثُما كُنْـت
hadiths.translation:
May Allah give you piety as your provision, 
forgive your sins, 
and make goodness easy for you wherever you are.
hadiths.transliteration:
Zawwadaka ‘llāhut-taqwā, 
wa ghafara dhanbak, 
wa yassara laka ‘l-khayra ḥaythu mā kunt.

title: Takbir and Tasbih during travel

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/135.
hadiths.text:
قَالَ جَابِرٌ رضي الله عنه: 
(كُنَّا إِذَا صَعَدْنَا كَبَّرْنَا، 
وَإِذَا نَزَلْنَا سَبَّحْنَا)
hadiths.translation:
Jabir (ra), said: Whenever we went up a hill we would say 
Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) 
and when we descended we would say 
Subḥānallāh (Glory is to Allah).

title: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 4/2086, the meaning of sami`a sāmi`un (who listens has heard) is 
that 'a witness has witnessed our praise of Allah due to His blessings and 
favor upon us.' It could also be read samma`a sāmi`un, in which case it 
means 'one who has heard this statement of mine will convey it to another 
and he will say it as well.' This is due to the attention given to the 
Thikr (remembrance of Allah) and supplications made during the early 
morning hours. The meaning of his saying 'Our Lord, be with us and bestow 
Your favor upon us' is: 'Our Lord, protect us and guard us. Bless us with 
Your numerous bounties, and avert from us every evil.' See An-Nawawi, Sharh 
Sahih Muslim 17/39.
hadiths.text:
سَمِـعَ سـامِعٌ بِحَمْـدِ اللهِ وَحُسْـنِ بَلائِـهِ عَلَيْـنا.
رَبَّنـا صـاحِبْـنا وَأَفْـضِل عَلَيْـنا 
عائِذاً باللهِ مِنَ النّـار
hadiths.translation:
He Who listens has heard that we praise Allah for the good things He gives us. 
Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us. 
I seek the protection of Allah from the Fire.
hadiths.transliteration:
Sami`a sāmi`un biḥamdillāhi wa ḥusni balā'ihi `alaynā. 
Rabbanā ṣāḥibnā, wa afḍil `alaynā, 
`ā'idhan billāhi minan-nār.

title: Stopping or lodging somewhere in travel and otherwise

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 4/2080.
hadiths.text: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِـماتِ اللّهِ التّـامّاتِ مِنْ شَـرِّ ما خَلَـق
hadiths.translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.
hadiths.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq.

title: While returning from travel

hadiths.reference: From every elevated point say Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) three times and then recite:
hadiths.text:
يُكَبِّرُ عَلَى كُلِّ شَرَفٍ ثَلاَثَ تَكْبِيرَاتٍ ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: 
لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ 
وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، 
لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، 
وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، 
آيِبُونَ، تَائِبُونَ، عَابِدُونَ، 
لِرَبِّنا حَامِدُونَ، 
صَدَقَ اللَّهُ وَعْدَهُ، 
وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، 
وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزابَ وَحْدَهُ
hadiths.translation:
Lā ilāha illallāh 
waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, 
lahu ‘l-mulku, walahu ‘l-ḥamd, 
wa Huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr, 
ā'ibūna, tā'ibūna,`ābidūn, 
li Rabbinā ḥāmidūn, 
sadaqallāhu wa`dah, 
wa nasara `abdah,
wa hazama ‘l-'aḥzāba waḥdah.
hadiths.transliteration:
From every elevated point say 
Allāhu Akbar (three times), 
and then recite:

title: What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news

hadiths.reference:
And if something happened that displeased him, he used to say:
Praise is to Allah in all circumstances.
hadiths.text: كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَسُرُّهُ قَالَ: (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ) وَإِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَكْرَهُهُ قَالَ: (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ)
hadiths.translation:
When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say:
Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected.
hadiths.transliteration:
When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say:
Alḥamdu lillāhi ‘lladhi bi ni`matihi tatimmuṣ-ṣāliḥāt.
And if something happened that displeased him, he used to say:
Alḥamdu lillāhi `alā kulli ḥāl.

title: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (saws)

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 1/288.
hadiths.text: قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (مَنْ صَلَّى عَلَيَّ صَلاَةً صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ بِهَا عَشْراً)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever prays for Allah's blessings upon me once, will be blessed for it by Allah ten times."

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/218, Ahmad 2/367. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu 
Dawud 2/383.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (لاَ تَجْعَلُوا قَبْرِي عِيداً وَصَلُّوا عَلَيَّ؛ فَإِنَّ صَلاَتَكُم تَبْلُغُنِي حَيْثُ كُنْتُمْ)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Do not make my grave a place of ritual celebration, but pray for Allah's blessings upon me, for your blessings reach me from wherever you are.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/551 and others. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/177 
and Sahihul-Jarai' As-Saghir 3/25.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (الْبَخِيلُ مَنْ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيَّ)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The miser is the one in whose presence I am mentioned yet does not pray for Allah's blessings upon me."

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim 2/421. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih An-Nasa'i 
1/274.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم:(إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَلاَئِكَةً سَيَّاحِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يُبَلِّغُونِي مِنْ أُمَّتِي السَّلاَمَ)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Indeed Allah has angels who roam the earth and they convey to me the greetings (or prayers of peace) of my Ummah (nation)."

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Abu Dawud (no. 2041). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/383.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (مَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَيَّ إِلاَّ رَدَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيَّ رُوحِيَ حَتَّى أَرُدَّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلاَمَ)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "No one sends greetings (or prayers of peace) upon me but Allah returns my soul to me so that I may return his greetings."

title: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 1/74 and others.
hadiths.text: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (لاَ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا، وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا، أَوَلاَ أَدُلُّكُم عَلَى شَيْءٍ إِذَا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحَابَبْتُم، أَفْشُوا السَّلاَمَ بَيْنَكُمْ)
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "You shall not enter Paradise until you believe, and you have not believed until you love one another. Shall I tell you of something you can do to make you love one another? Spread the greetings of Salam (peace) amongst yourselves (i.e. between each other).

hadiths.text: ثَلاَثٌ مَنْ جَمَعَهُنَّ فَقَدْ جَمَعَ الْإِيمَانَ: الْإِنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، وَبَذْلُ السَّلاَمِ لِلْعَالَمِ، وَالْإِنْفَاقُ مِنَ الإِقْتَارِ
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/82 as a statement of the 
Companion 'Ammar (RA).
hadiths.transliteration: Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith: to be just, to spread greetings to all people and to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/55, Muslim 1/65.
hadiths.text: وَعَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمَا: أنَّ رَجُلاً سَأَلَ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أيُّ الْإِسْلاَمِ خَيْرٌ قَالَ: (تُطْعِمُ الطَّعَامَ، وَتَقْرأُ السَّلاَمَ عَلَى مَنْ عَرَفْتَ وَمَنْ لَمْ تَعْرِفْ)
hadiths.translation: `Abdullah bin `Umar (RA) said: A man asked the Prophet (ﷺ), "What is the best act of Islam?" He said, "To feed others and to give greetings of Salam (peace) to those whom you know and to those whom you do not know. "

title: Returning a greeting to a disbeliever

hadiths.reference: And upon you .
hadiths.text: إذَا سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ فَقُولُوا: وَعَلَيْكُمْ
hadiths.translation: If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e. Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu `alaykum, then say (to him):
hadiths.transliteration: If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e. Christians and Jews) greets you, saying As-Salāmu `alaykum, then say (to him): Wa `alaykum.

title: Upon hearing a rooster crow or the braying of a donkey

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/350, Muslim 4/2092.
hadiths.text: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ صِيَاحَ الدِّيَكَةِ فَاسْأَلُوا اللَّهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ؛ فَإِنَّهَا رَأَتْ مَلَكاً وَإِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نَهِيقَ الْحِمَارِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ؛ فَإِنَّهُ رَأَى شَيْطَاناً
hadiths.translation: When you hear the cock's crow, ask Allah for His favor upon you for surely it has seen an angel. When you hear the bray of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for surely it has seen a devil.

title: Upon hearing the barking of dogs at night

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Abu Dawud 4/327, Ahmad 3/306. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu 
Dawud 3/961.
hadiths.text: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نُبَاحَ الْكِلاَبِ وَنَهِيقَ الْحَمِيرِ بِاللَّيْلِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْهُنَّ؛ فَإِنَّهُنَّ يَرَيْنَ مَا لاَ تَرَوْنَ
hadiths.translation: When you hear a dog barking or a donkey braying in the night, then seek refuge in Allah from them, for surely they have seen what you see not.

title: For one you have insulted

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wording 
in Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source of 
mercy.
hadiths.text: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: "اللَّهُم فأيما مؤمن سببته فاجعل ذلك له قربة إليك يوم القيامة"
hadiths.translation: O Allah, whomever of the believers I have abused, give him the reward of a sacrificial slaughter for it on the Day of Resurrection.
hadiths.transliteration:
Allāhumma fa'ayyumā mu'minin sababtuhu 
faj`al dhālika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawma ‘l-qiyāmah.

title: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 4/2296.
hadiths.text: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: "إِذَا كَانَ أَحَدُكُم مَادِحاً صَاحِبَهُ لاَ مَحَالَةَ فَلْيَقُلْ: أَحْسِبُ فُلاَناً وَاللَّهُ حَسِيبُهُ، وَلاَ أُزَكِّي عَلَى اللَّهِ أَحَداً، أَحْسِبُهُ – إِنْ كَانَ يَعْلَمُ ذَاكَ – كَذَا وَكَذَا"
hadiths.translation:
If any of you praises his companion then let him say:
I consider (such and such a person), and Allah is his Assessor, (meaning: and I cannot claim anyone to be pious before Allah) if you know of this (good character trait in the person) to be such and such (saying what he thinks is praiseworthy in that person).
hadiths.transliteration:
If any of you praises his companion then let him say:
Aḥsibu fulānan wallāhu ḥasībuh
wa lā uzakkī  `alallāhi aḥada.

title: For the one that have been praised

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adabul-Mufrad no. 761. See Al-Albani, Sahih 
Al-'Adabul-Mufrad (no. 585). The portion between brackets if from 
Al-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman 4/228, and comes another account.
hadiths.text:
اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِي بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
وَاغْفِرْ لِي مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ 
[وَاجْعَلْنِي خَيْرًا مِمَّا يَظُّنُّونَ]
hadiths.translation:
O Allah, do not call me to account for what they say
and forgive me for what they have no knowledge of 
[and make me better than they imagine].
hadiths.transliteration:
Allāhumma lā tu'ākhidhnī bimā yaqūlūn, 
waghfir lī mā lā ya`lamūn
[waj`alnī khayran mimmā yaẓunnūn].

title: The Talbiya for the one doing Hajj or 'Umrah

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/408, Muslim 2/841.
hadiths.text:
لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ، 
لَبَّيْكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ، 
إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَة لَكَ والمُلْكُ، 
لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
hadiths.translation:
I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service. 
I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service. 
Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion. 
You have no partner.
hadiths.transliteration:
Labbayk-Allāhumma labbayk, 
labbayka lā sharīka laka labbayk,
inna ‘l-ḥamda, wanni`mata, laka wa ‘l-mulk, 
lā sharīka lak.

title: The Takbîr passing the black stone

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The 
'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane.
hadiths.text: طَافَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْبَيْتِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ كُلَّمَا أَتَى الرُّكْنَ أَشَارَ إِلَيْهِ بِشَيْءٍ عِنْدَهُ وَكَبَّرَ
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) performed Tawaf riding a camel. Every time he passed the corner (containing the Black Stone), he would point to it with something that he was holding and say: Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great)!

title: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albani 
graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354. The Ayat is from Surat Al-Baqarah, 
2:201.
hadiths.text:
﴿رَبَّنَا آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حسَنَةً
وفي الآخِرَةِ حسَنةً 
وقِنَا عذَابَ النَّارِ﴾
hadiths.translation:
Our Lord, grant us the good things in this world,
and the good things in the next life,
and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
hadiths.transliteration:
Rabbanā ātinā fid-dunyā ḥasanah 
wa fi ‘l-ākhirati ḥasanah 
wa qinā `adhāban-nār.

title: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah

hadiths.reference: Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. I begin by that which Allah began.
hadiths.text: (لَمَّا دَنَا النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنَ الصَّفَا قَرَأَ: ﴿إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآئِرِ اللَّهِ﴾ "أَبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأَ اللَّهُ بِهِ" فَبَدَأَ بِالصَّفَا فَرَقِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى رَأَى الْبَيْتَ، فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ، فَوَحَّدَ اللَّهَ وَكبَّرَهُ وَقَالَ: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ، أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ، وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ، ثُمَّ دَعَا بَيْنَ ذلكَ. قَالَ مِثْلَ هَذَا ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ) الْحَدِيثُ. وَفِيهِ: (فَفَعَلَ عَلَى الْمَرْوَةِ كَمَا فَعَلَ عَلَى الصَّفَا)
hadiths.translation: Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:
hadiths.transliteration:
Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:
Innaṣ-Ṣafā wa ‘l-Marwata min sha`ā'irillāh. 
Abda'u bimā bada'allāhu bih.
He began (his Sa`y) at Mount Safa climbing it, until he could see the House. He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words:
Lā ilāha illallāh, Allāhu Akbar
Then he said:
Lā ilāha 'illallāh
waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, 
Lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd
wa Huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr, 
lā 'ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu, 
anjaza wa`dahu, wa naṣara `abdahu, 
wa hazama ‘l 'aḥzāba waḥdah.
Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.

title: The Day of 'Arafah

hadiths.reference:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah 
Alone, Who has no partner. 
His is the dominion and His is the praise,
and He is Able to do all things.
hadiths.text:
خير الدعاء دعاء يوم عرفة ، وخيرُ ما قلت أنا والنبيُّون من قبلي :
لا إله إلا الله وحدهُ
لا شريك لهُ ،
لهُ الملكُ ولهُ الحمدُ
وهو على كل شيء قدير.
hadiths.translation:
Lā 'ilāha 'illallāhu 
waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu, 
lahul-mulku wa lahul-ḥamdu 
wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
hadiths.transliteration: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The best invocation is that of the Day of Arafat, and the best that anyone can say is what I and the Prophets before me have said:

title: Remembrance at Muzdalifa

hadiths.text: رَكِبَ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْقَصْوَاءَ حَتَّى أَتَى الْمَشْعَرَ الْحَرَامَ فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ (فَدَعَاهُ، وَكَبَّرَهُ، وَهَللَّهُ، وَوَحَّدَهُ) فَلَمْ يَزَلْ وَاقِفاً حَتَّى أَسْفَرَ جِدَّاً فَدَفَعَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمسُ.
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Muslim 2/891.
hadiths.transliteration: 'He (ﷺ) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-MashAAar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'

title: Takbir when throwing each pebble at the Jamarat

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/581, 3, 4, and Muslim
hadiths.text: يُكَبِّرُ كُلَّمَا رَمَى بِحَصَاةٍ عِنْدَ الْجِمَارِ الثَّلاَثِ، ثُمَّ يَتَقَدَّمُ، ويَقِفُ يَدْعُو مُسْتَقْبِلَ الْقِبلَةِ، رَافِعاً يَدَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْجَمْرَةِ الْأُولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ. أَمَّا جَمْرَةُ الْعَقَبَةِ فَيَرْمِيهَا وَيُكَبِّرُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ وَيَنْصَرِفُ وَلاَ يَقِفُ عِنْدَهَا
hadiths.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) with each pebble he threw at the three pillars. Then he went forward, stood facing the Qiblah, and raised his hands and called upon Allah. That was after (stoning) the first and second pillars. As for the third, he stoned it and called out Allāhu Akbar with every pebble he threw, but when he was finished he left without standing at it (for supplications).

title: At times of amazement and that which delights

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/210, 390, 414 and Muslim 4/1857.
hadiths.text: سُـبْحانَ الله
hadiths.translation: (Glory is to Allah).
hadiths.transliteration: Subḥānallāh!

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/441. See also Al-Albani, Sahih 
At-Tirmidhi 2/103, 235, Ahmad 5/218.
hadiths.text: اللهُ أَكْـبَر
hadiths.translation: (Allah is the Most Great)
hadiths.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar!

title: Upon receiving pleasant news

hadiths.text: كَانَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ أَمْرٌ يَسُرُّهُ أَوْ يُسَرُّ بِهِ خَرَّ سَاجِداً شُكْراً لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 
1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226.
hadiths.transliteration: The Prophet (ﷺ), upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure, would prostrate in gratitude to Allah blessed and exalted.

title: When feeling some pain in the body

hadiths.reference:
Then say seven times:
I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.
hadiths.text:
ضَعْ يَدَكَ عَلَى الَّذِي تَألَّمَ مِنْ جَسَدِكَ وَقُلْ:
"بِسْمِ اللَّهِ" ثَلاَثاً، 
وَقُلْ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ: 
"أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ"
hadiths.translation:
Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say:
With the Name of Allah (three times).
hadiths.transliteration:
Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say: 
Bismillāh (three times).
Then say seven times:
A`ūdhu billāhi wa qudratihi min sharri mā ajidu wa uḥādhir.

title: When in fear of afflicting something with an (evil) eye from oneself

hadiths.text: إِذَا رَأَى أَحَدُكُم مِنْ أَخِيهِ، أَوْ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ، أَوْ مِنْ مَالِهِ مَا يُعْجِبُهُ [فَلْيَدْعُ لَهُ بِالْبَرَكَةِ] فَإِنَّ الْعَيْنَ حَقٌّ
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Ahmad 4/447, Ibn Majah, Malik. Al-Albani graded it authentic in 
Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/212. Also see Al-Arna'ut's checking of Ibn 
Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad 4/170.
hadiths.transliteration: If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.

title: When startled

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/181, Muslim 4/2208.
hadiths.text: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ
hadiths.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!
hadiths.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh!

title: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 3/ 1557, Al-Bayhaqi 9/287.
hadiths.text:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ 
وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ 
[اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَلَكَ] 
اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي
hadiths.translation:
With the Name of Allah,
Allah is the Most Great! 
[O Allah, from You and to You.] 
O Allah, accept it from me.
hadiths.transliteration:
Bismillāh wallāhu Akbar 
[Allāhumma minka wa lak] 
Allāhumma taqabbal minnī.

title: To ward off the plot of the rebellious devils

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 
637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'Aqidah 
At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.
hadiths.text:
أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ ولَا فَاجرٌ 
مِنْ شّرِّ مَا خَلقَ، 
وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ، 
ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ 
وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فيهَا، 
ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِ 
ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا، 
وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ، 
ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طارِقٍ 
إِلَّا طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍ 
يَا رَحْمَنُ
hadiths.translation:
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome -
from the evil of what He created, 
of what He made, and of what He scattered,
from the evil of what descends from the 
heavens, 
and of what rises up to them, 
from the evil of what He scattered in the earth, 
and of what emerges from it, 
from the evil trials of night and day, 
and from the evil of every night visitor,
except the night visitor who comes with good. 
O Merciful One.
hadiths.transliteration:
A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti ‘llatī lā yujāwizuhunna barrun wa lā fājirun
min sharri mā khalaq, 
wa bara'a wa dhara', 
wa min sharri mā yanzilu minas-samā', 
wa min sharri mā ya`ruju fīhā, 
wa min sharri mā dhara'a fi ‘l-arḍ, 
wa min sharri ma yakhruju minhā, 
wa min sharri fitani ‘llayli wannahār, 
wa min sharri kulli ṭāriqin 
illā ṭāriqan yaṭruqu bikhayr 
yā Rahmān.

title: Seeking forgiveness and repentance

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101.
hadiths.text: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: "وَاللَّهِ إِنِّي لأَسْتَغفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةٍ"
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "By Allah, I seek the forgiveness of Allah, and repent to Him more than seventy times in a day.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 4/2076.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَإِنِّي أَتُوبُ فِي الْيَوْمِ إِلَيْهِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ)
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O people, repent to Allah, for I verily repent to Him one hundred times a day.

hadiths.reference:
I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal, 
and I repent to Him, 
Allah will forgive him even if he has deserted the army's ranks.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الْعَظيمَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيّوُمُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ)، غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
Astaghfirullāha ‘l-'Aẓīm
alladhi lā ilāha illā huwa ‘l-ḥayyul-Qayyūm 
wa atūbu ilayh.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih 
At-Tirmidhi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الرَّبُّ مِنَ الْعَبْدِ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ فَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مِمَّنْ يَذْكُرُ اللَّهَ فِي تِلْكَ السَّاعَةِ فَكُنْ
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The closest that the Lord comes to the slave is in the last portion of the night. So, if you are able to be among those who remember Allah in this hour, then be among them."

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 1/350.
hadiths.text: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأَكثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The closest that the slave comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so invoke Allah much (in prostration)."

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (ﷺ) was always 
vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to 
do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, 
he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the 
forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.
hadiths.text: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: إِنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ عَلَى قَلْبِي وَإِنِّي لأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ فِي الْيَوْمِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is a heavy thing for my heart if I do not seek Allah's forgiveness a hundred times a day."

title: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir

hadiths.reference: Glorified is Allah and praised is He.
hadiths.text: قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ حُطَّتْ خَطَايَاهُ وَلَوْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْر.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdihi.
one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.

hadiths.reference:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. 
His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ) عَشْرَ مِرَارٍ، كَانَ كَمَنْ أَعْتَقَ أَرْبَعَةَ أَنْفُسٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:
Lā ilāha illallāh
waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, 
lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd 
wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr.
ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma'il.

hadiths.reference: Glorified is Allah and praised is He, Glorified is Allah the Most Great.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ، ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ، حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ)، (سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ)
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One:
Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih, 
Subḥānallāhi ‘l-`Aẓīm.

hadiths.reference:
Glory is to Allah, 
and praise is to Allah, 
and there is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and Allah is the Most Great.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: لَأَنْ أَقُولَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمسُ.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: For me to say:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: For me to say:
Subḥānallāh, 
walḥamdu lillāh, 
wa lā ilāha illallāh, 
wallāhu 'Akbar 
is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon (i.e. the whole world).

hadiths.reference:
"Is anyone of you incapable of earning one thousand Hasanah (rewards) in a day?" 
Someone from his gathering asked, "How can anyone of us earn a thousand Hasanah?" 
He said, "Glorify Allah a hundred times and a thousand Hasanah will be written for you, or a thousand sins will be wiped away."
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَيَعْجِزُ أَحَدُكُم أَنْ يَكْسِبَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ فَسَأَلَهُ سَائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسَائِهِ كَيْفَ يَكْسِبُ أَحَدُنَا أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ قَالَ: يُسَبِّحُ مِائَةَ تَسْبِيحَةٍ، فَيُكتَبُ لَهُ أَلْفُ حَسَنَةٍ أَوْ يُحَطُّ عَنْهُ أَلْفُ خَطِيئَةٍ.
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:

hadiths.reference: Glorified is Allah the Most Great and praised is He.
hadiths.text: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) غُرِسَتْ لَهُ نَخْلَةٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ
hadiths.translation: Whoever says:
hadiths.transliteration:
Whoever says:
Subḥānallāhi ‘l-'Aẓīmi wa biḥamdih
will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.

hadiths.reference:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/213, Muslim 4/2076.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ قَيْسٍ أَلاَ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَى كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الْجَنَّةِ؟ فَقُلْتُ: بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ).
hadiths.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise?" 
I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." 
So he told me to say:
There is no power and no might except by Allah.
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise?" 
I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." 
So he told me to say:
Lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata 'illā billāh.

hadiths.reference:
Glorified is Allah, 
and
The praise is for Allah, 
and
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, 
and
Allah is the Most Great.
hadiths.text: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَحَبُّ الْكَلاَمِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَرْبَعٌ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ)، وَ(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَ(لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)، وَ(اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، لاَ يَضُرُّكَ بِأَيِّهِنَّ بَدَأتَ
hadiths.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four:
hadiths.transliteration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four:
Subḥānallāh
Walḥamdu lillāh.
Wa lā ilāha illallāh
Wallāhu Akbar.

hadiths.reference: A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a word that I can say. " The Prophet told him to say:
hadiths.text: جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ: عَلِّمْنِي كَلاماً أَقُولُهُ: قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ). قَالَ: فَهَؤُلاَءِ لِرَبِّي، فَمَا لِي؟ قَالَ: قُلْ (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي).
hadiths.translation:
He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?" The Prophet (ﷺ) told 
him to say:
Allāhummaghfir lī, warḥamnī, waḥdinī warzuqnī.
hadiths.transliteration:
A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a word 
that I can say. " The Prophet told him to say:
Lā ilāha illallāh
waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, 
Allāhu Akbaru kabīra, 
walḥamdu lillāhi kathīra, 
Subḥānallāhi Rabbil-`ālamīn, 
Lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāhi ‘l-`Azīzil-Hakīm.

hadiths.reference: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide for me.
hadiths.text: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم الصَّلاَةَ ثُمَّ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَدْعُوَ بِهَؤُلاَءِ الْكَلِمَاتِ: (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرِ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَعَافِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي)
hadiths.translation: Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:
hadiths.transliteration:
Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to 
pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:
Allāhummaghfir lī, warḥamnī, waḥdinī, wa `āfinī warzuqnī.

hadiths.reference: The most excellent invocation is:
hadiths.text: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ الدُّعَاءِ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَأَفْضَلَ الذِّكْرِ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)
hadiths.translation:
and the most excellent words of remembrance are:
Lā ilāha illallāh.
hadiths.transliteration:
The most excellent invocation is:
Alḥamdulillāh

hadiths.reference:
Glorified is Allah, 
and
The praise is for Allah, 
and
There is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and
Allah is the Most Great,
and
There is no power and no might except by Allah.
hadiths.text: الباقيات الصالحات : (سبحان الله) و(الحمد لله )، و(لا إله إلا الله)، و(الله أكبر) ،و (لا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله).
hadiths.translation: The good deeds which endure are:
hadiths.transliteration:
The good deeds which endure are:
Subḥānallāh.
Walḥamdu lillāh.
Wa lā ilāha illallāh
Wallāhu Akbar
Wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.

title: How the Prophet ﷺ made tasbeeh

hadiths.text: عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو رضي الله عنهما قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَعْقِدُ التَّسْبِيحَ بِيَمِينِهِ.
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Abu Dawud with a different wording 2/81, and At-Tirmidhi 5/521. See also 
Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 4/271 (no. 4865).
hadiths.transliteration:
Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA) said: "I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) counting the 
glorification of his Lord on his right hand."

title: Comprehensive types of good and manners

hadiths.text: إِذَا كَانَ جُنْحُ اللَّيْلِ – أَوْ أَمْسَيْتُم – فَـكُفُّوا صِبْيانَـكُم، فَإِنَّ الشَّيَاطِينَ تَنْتَشِرُ حِينَئِذٍ، فَإِذَا ذَهَبَ سَاعَةٌ مِنَ اللَّيلِ فَخَلُّوهُمْ، وَأَغْلِقُوا الأَبْوَابَ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ؛ فَإِنَّ الشَّيطَانَ لاَ يَفْتَحُ بَاباً مُغلَقاً، وَأَوْكُوا قِرَبَكُمْ، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ، وَخَمِّرُوا آنِيَتَكُم، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ، وَلَوْ أَنْ تَعْرُضُوا عَلَيْهَا شَيْئاً، وَأَطْفِئُوا مَصَابِيحَكُمْ.
hadiths.translation:
Reference:
Al-Bukhari with Al-Fath 10/88 and Muslim 3/1595.
hadiths.transliteration: When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah’s name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention Allah’s name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah’s name and put out your lamps.
